I ordered the 4 books through the representative from re-stocks and thought everything was fine.  I received a box of 25 "Top Secret UV Pens" -- not my order.  I called back  again and again ordered the 4 pre-paid books, and I did finally receive them.  My students were glad to finally get them, but the wrong package caused them to have to wait additional time.  I know that mistakes do happen, but it does affect my score for this delivery.  All others have been great!

What Issues: The order was correct. It wouldn't allow me to use the coupon I earned.
What could we improve: I have been a customer for 25 years. This year I have really promoted the book orders. In the January order I earned a $10 coupon  to be used only in the month of February. So I really hyped it up. I sent a few emails, etc. Then I earned $10 for the order. NO WHERE ON THE COUPON DOES IT SAY YOU CAN'T COMBINE COUPONS. I was on chat help for 30 minutes. Her supervisor said no. That makes no sense to me. I promote your company, earn a coupon, and can't use it. That was extremely frustrating.
Additional Comments: I know I keep saying it. But I do a lot to encourage families to buy books from you. It takes time to email them, do the order, and unpackage and hand out the orders. I would hope you would honor teachers' coupons when they are earned. Now it is too late. Hopefully many bonus points will be added to my total. That would be appreciated. Thanks!

What could we improve: I ordered with some money in my ewallet that had been there for a while because I was waiting to be able to use it in your online store. The ordering process was a little clunky which might explain why, a couple years ago, I couldn't transfer those funds from my ewallet to a gift card like your website says I can. So I waited a while to be able to do that. Then, when I did finally manage to use those funds, I got 24 book order form packets with my 2 books. I got 4 for each class K-5. This is such a waste since I am an auxiliary teacher for K-5, not a classroom teacher. But shipping was fairly fast.
When calling in an order, the wait time and the time to answer questions is very long and can be confusing.
Additional Comments: I was disappointed that I could not use my points to buy certain books for my students during the holidays.  I have been doing Scholastic Book Clubs for many years and I have collected many points that I feel should be used to benefit my students.

What could we improve: My second order this school year required me to box up and return a book set that was accidently sent by Scholastic with my order.  I taught for 6 years and had monthly book orders from 1990-1996 before computers/high tech automation, yet only had 1 error in shipping and I was allowed to keep the  boxed set back then!  Hopefully, the shipping department is working on quality control (hiring people that can read) since it is time-consuming to call, print out the label, box up the book set, take it to the UPS store/USPS to ship it, and type up this survey.
Additional Comments: I have enjoyed the 5 for $5 books which I have purchased, received free, or used bonus points.  The books go into a class store where students can buy books by using their class "cash" (fake money spontaneously earned for random acts of kindness/working quietly/etc. which they learn to save, spend, or  donate for a class party).  As a private Christian school with tuition, students' families can't always afford to buy books for their students so I have added books that I earn or buy to the class store. :)

I used the packaging receipt to sort the books and try to track down the other student.  The other teacher then questioned me as to where the rest of the order was.  I was very surprised and disappointed with Scholastic.  I reached out to the company to make personnel aware of the issue.  I was told it was a warehouse issue.  I first used Scholastic in 2006.  I then stopped and restarted this year.  I now remember why I stopped using the company.

My class spent over $25, and I received the usual $10 coupon for free books. I was also sent a $10 coupon certificate to use the following month to order free books as well. When I went to put in the coupon for the following month, it said I had to have a $25 order. My order was only for $18. What’s the purpose of getting a coupon for the following month with the requirement of spending $25 when you already offer the $10 coupon with a $25 order each month anyway. It was very disheartening.
Additional Comments: I wish there wasn’t a spending limit to qualify for free shipping. Last month, my class had a large order, and I received free shipping. This month they are only spending $18, which means I either have to buy books myself to pay the $7.00 difference to qualify for free shipping, or I have to pay $6.50 of my own money so my kids can get the books they ordered. I don’t feel I should have to pay anything for my students to receive the books they ordered.

What Issues: This problem was specified in my paragraph earlier.
What could we improve: Your online orders only show as the first name of a student. It's very frustrating for a teacher, and embarrassing, if there are two or more students with the same name in the class. Also, not on the online order is the parent to place the order. This year, I have a situation with a bitter divorce, and the parents don't speak to each other. Both order books online for their child named Connor. However, all that shows up is his first name, so I have no idea which day I should send the books home because I'm not sure which parent ordered . Whether it's a situation with a student who shares the same first name as another student in the classroom or a divorce situation - It forces us to contact both families/parents and ask if they placed a recent order… This shouldn't be and is a big waste of time. To solve this problem, why don't you make sure that the students first and last name is on the order when a teacher received notice that there is an online order?
Additional Comments: This is not the first time I have asked about why you only have the students first name on an online order. It's been going on for the last couple of years and I have given you feedback and filled out forms just like this one to no avail. It makes me feel like you're not listening. I am your sales person realistically. It makes me not want to promote Scholastic if I am not heard.

Additional Comments: I hope that I do not have to use costumer service in the future, but things arise. If and when I do I hope to have more friendly or helpful service. One month my digital item list was not found and I recycled my print out. When my box came there was not a packing slip. I called to ask if they could see it on Scholastic's end and I was rudely told that you do not send out a packing slip that have the child's names on it; which was/is false, I receive them every order. Another time I helped out my school by purchasing digital gift cards (to be later reimbursed by my admin) and although I received the three gift card amounts I only received a receipt for one. I emailed customer service twice with my info and reason for contacting. I never received a reply. I then physically called and was told I had to wait for email correspondence. I never heard back and I ate the purchase. Also this year our secretary sent in a paper check for a student who did not order online. My Scholastic account online still shows a negative balance. She has contacted Scholastic twice and ensures me that customer service stated that they received our check and attached it to our account.

Overall, I am satisfied.  I am not super excited about the current bonus point coupon situation that is happening right now.  I had a $10 coupon from my January order and I had $10 to spend right now.  In my mind, I was thinking I had $20 to spend. I was going to order the new hardbound $19 Jan Yolen dinosaur book with my bonus points.  With this current system, I wasn't able to order any item that was over $10.   I had to choose other books that I was less interested in and ended up not ordering the Jan Yolen book at all.  I find that kind of annoying.  Maybe it is possible to combine coupons, but that isn't clear in the ordering process.  I preferred the old, the more you spend, the more you get system because I could order more expensive items with my bonus points.
Additional Comments: Please see my earlier comment about bonus points.

What was great: Super easy to order online and this year the books are coming within days!  Thank you!

What was great: I love the quality, selection, price and ease of ordering books through scholastic.  My families appreciate it too.  Delivery has been a hit or miss for my school, (PO Box) so now I am having it delivered to my home and bringing the box to school.  It is much quicker.

What was great: Faster delivery
very timely

What Issues: I got an email that my order could not be delivered on saturday....did you expect me to be at school on Saturday?
What could we improve: I had one kids whose parent sent in cash to order a $6 book. because it was the only non-digital order I had to pay $6 shipping. So am I supposed to tell the kid that they can't order a book? Should I write the parent a note and say you were the only order so the price doubled? I paid the $6. But it's crappy on your part to put me in that position.  Also this student requested a second book but when I tried to put it into the system I was denied because you were out of stock. So AGAIN I had to write the parent a note, return the money and say "sorry". This is a crappy situation for me to be in. I suspect this has no remedy and as a consequence I don't really want to use Scholastic. It is optional on my part anyway.

I would prefer to either have a choice in substituted books or not have the out of stock books replaced with other books that you choose.

Because I don't have many students ordering I have to pay shipping out of my own money.  I won't be ordering anymore this year because it's costing me my own money to offer book orders.
I do not like that in order to use coupons your class order has to be 25$. I would like to use the 10$ coupon that I earned without it being dependent on my student orders that month.

What could we improve: I do not feel it is fair to charge a shipping fee if you have a small order (under $25 if I remember correctly). I had two student who did not order at the same time. If they had ordered at the same time (as I asked them to), we would not have been charged the shipping. But because they turned it in on different days, I was expected to cover that cost. Luckily, I pled my case to a customer service representative and they waived that fee for me. Which I very much appreciate. But I know they will not do that every time for everyone...
